sense.name: individual, organization or tool that produces, creates something
sense.examples: Jack was a maker of fine furniture until he developed arthritis. Mary was a biotech market maker on Wall Street for a number of years. Have you tried using your new bread maker yet? The maker of this steel-belted tire has issued a recall on last year's model. Most of the makers of memory chips are situated in Asia. His family's firm has been a maker of fine bourbon for generations. She is the decision maker in that family when it comes to finances. (extension of core meaning)

sense.name: divine being, usually creator of everything
sense.commentary: MAKER[+supernatural][+divinity] Note: usually intended as an instance rather than a type.
sense.examples: John prepared to meet his Maker. Mary suspects there is no divine maker of the universe, only forces of nature. The natives worship this deity as the maker of fire.
